plugin.name: Apache Maven Project Info Reports Plugin
plugin.description: The Maven Project Info Reports Plugin is a plugin that generates standard reports for the specified project.

mojo.description: Generates the Project Continuous Integration Management report.

parameter.name: customBundle
parameter.description: Path for a custom bundle instead of using the default one. Using this field, you could change the texts in the generated reports.

parameter.name: outputDirectory
parameter.description: The output directory for the report. Note that this parameter is only evaluated if the goal is run directly from the command line. If the goal is run indirectly as part of a site generation, the output directory configured in the Maven Site Plugin is used instead.

parameter.name: remoteRepositories
parameter.description: Remote repositories used for the project.

parameter.name: skip
parameter.description: Skip report.

parameter.name: skipEmptyReport
parameter.description: Skip the project info report generation if a report-specific section of the POM is empty. Defaults to true.

parameter.name: customBundle
parameter.description: Path for a custom bundle instead of using the default one. Using this field, you could change the texts in the generated reports.

parameter.name: dependencyDetailsEnabled
parameter.description: Display file details for each dependency, such as: file size, number of classes, number of packages etc.

parameter.name: dependencyLocationsEnabled
parameter.description: Display the repository locations of the dependencies. If Maven is configured to be offline, this parameter will be ignored.

parameter.name: outputDirectory
parameter.description: The output directory for the report. Note that this parameter is only evaluated if the goal is run directly from the command line. If the goal is run indirectly as part of a site generation, the output directory configured in the Maven Site Plugin is used instead.

parameter.name: remoteRepositories
parameter.description: Remote repositories used for the project.

parameter.name: skip
parameter.description: Skip report.

parameter.name: skipEmptyReport
parameter.description: Skip the project info report generation if a report-specific section of the POM is empty. Defaults to true.

mojo.description: Display help information on maven-project-info-reports-plugin. Call mvn project-info-reports:help -Ddetail=true -Dgoal=<goal-name> to display parameter details.

parameter.name: detail
parameter.description: If true, display all settable properties for each goal.

parameter.name: goal
parameter.description: The name of the goal for which to show help. If unspecified, all goals will be displayed.

parameter.name: indentSize
parameter.description: The number of spaces per indentation level, should be positive.

parameter.name: lineLength
parameter.description: The maximum length of a display line, should be positive.

parameter.name: customBundle
parameter.description: Path for a custom bundle instead of using the default one. Using this field, you could change the texts in the generated reports.

parameter.name: outputDirectory
parameter.description: The output directory for the report. Note that this parameter is only evaluated if the goal is run directly from the command line. If the goal is run indirectly as part of a site generation, the output directory configured in the Maven Site Plugin is used instead.

parameter.name: remoteRepositories
parameter.description: Remote repositories used for the project.

parameter.name: skip
parameter.description: Skip report.

parameter.name: skipEmptyReport
parameter.description: Skip the project info report generation if a report-specific section of the POM is empty. Defaults to true.

parameter.name: customBundle
parameter.description: Path for a custom bundle instead of using the default one. Using this field, you could change the texts in the generated reports.

parameter.name: customBundle
parameter.description: Path for a custom bundle instead of using the default one. Using this field, you could change the texts in the generated reports.

parameter.name: licenseFileEncoding
parameter.description: Specifies the input encoding of the project's license file(s).

parameter.name: linkOnly
parameter.description: Whether the only render links to the license documents instead of inlining them. If the system is in offline mode, the linkOnly parameter will be always true.

parameter.name: offline
parameter.description: Whether the system is currently offline.

parameter.name: outputDirectory
parameter.description: The output directory for the report. Note that this parameter is only evaluated if the goal is run directly from the command line. If the goal is run indirectly as part of a site generation, the output directory configured in the Maven Site Plugin is used instead.

parameter.name: remoteRepositories
parameter.description: Remote repositories used for the project.

parameter.description: Skip report.

parameter.name: skipEmptyReport
parameter.description: Skip the project info report generation if a report-specific section of the POM is empty. Defaults to true.

parameter.name: customBundle
parameter.description: Path for a custom bundle instead of using the default one. Using this field, you could change the texts in the generated reports.

parameter.name: introduction
parameter.deprecated: since 2.3, you should use a custom bundle.
parameter.description: This can override the header text of the mailing list(s) report

parameter.description: The output directory for the report. Note that this parameter is only evaluated if the goal is run directly from the command line. If the goal is run indirectly as part of a site generation, the output directory configured in the Maven Site Plugin is used instead.

parameter.name: showAvatarImages
parameter.description: Shows avatar images for team members that have a) properties/picUrl set b) An avatar at gravatar.com for their email address Future versions of this plugin may choose to implement different strategies for resolving avatar images, possibly using different providers. Note: This property will be renamed to tteam.showAvatarImages in 3.0.

parameter.name: skip
parameter.description: Skip report.

parameter.name: skipEmptyReport
parameter.description: Skip the project info report generation if a report-specific section of the POM is empty. Defaults to true.

mojo.description: Generates the Project Source Code Management (SCM) report.

parameter.name: anonymousConnection
parameter.description: The SCM anonymous connection url respecting the SCM URL Format.

parameter.name: checkoutDirectoryName
parameter.description: The directory name to checkout right after the SCM URL.

parameter.name: customBundle
parameter.description: Path for a custom bundle instead of using the default one. Using this field, you could change the texts in the generated reports.

parameter.name: developerConnection
parameter.description: The SCM developer connection url respecting the SCM URL Format.

parameter.name: outputDirectory
parameter.description: The output directory for the report. Note that this parameter is only evaluated if the goal is run directly from the command line. If the goal is run indirectly as part of a site generation, the output directory configured in the Maven Site Plugin is used instead.

parameter.name: remoteRepositories
parameter.description: Remote repositories used for the project.

parameter.name: scmTag
parameter.description: The SCM tag.

parameter.name: skip
parameter.description: Skip report.

parameter.name: skipEmptyReport
parameter.description: Skip the project info report generation if a report-specific section of the POM is empty. Defaults to true.

parameter.name: webAccessUrl
parameter.description: The SCM web access url.

parameter.name: customBundle
parameter.description: Path for a custom bundle instead of using the default one. Using this field, you could change the texts in the generated reports.

parameter.name: outputDirectory
parameter.description: The output directory for the report. Note that this parameter is only evaluated if the goal is run directly from the command line. If the goal is run indirectly as part of a site generation, the output directory configured in the Maven Site Plugin is used instead.
